Signals from other neurons are received at the  dendrites  and  the cell body of a receiving neuron
If the signal exceeds the threshold, it is pushed out of the cell body and down the  axon towards the  synapse between this neuron and the next one.
he signal travels to the end of the axon, called the terminal button , where the signal travels across the synapse to the next neuron.
